title: U.S. Hostage and Wrongful Detainee Day, 2025
summary: The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump designating March 9, 2025, as U.S. Hostage and Wrongful Detainee Day. It expresses solidarity with American citizens held captive abroad, affirming the commitment to their safe return and justice against their captors. The President highlights the release of 13 Americans during his administration, including individuals detained in Venezuela, Afghanistan, Belarus, Russia, and Hamas. He emphasizes the ongoing effort to secure the release of all unjustly detained Americans, stating that the U.S. will not tolerate such actions. The proclamation calls for national observance of the day with relevant programs and ceremonies, reinforcing a commitment to peace through strength and the importance of family reunification. The establishment of this day is backed by Public Law 11831, approved in December 2023.
